page.title: 14Travellers' Site
page.content:
{The Hapsford Travellers'Site}opened in 1974 and it belonged to the Cheshire County Council.In 1975 a school opened on the site and all the Travellers' children went there.{Mrs.Finch,}who still works at Dunham Hill School, worked there.In 1979 the Site and the site School closed down for two years and it re-opened in 1981.
But the school did not re-open.{Mr.and {Mrs.W.Smith}run the site now on behalf of the{National Gypsy Council,}which is called{"Romano Kris"}in the Romany language.The Travellers' children now attend the Dunham Hill C.P.School. In 1985{23}different Traveller children came to School.Most Travellers stay for between 6 and 10 weeks.Some return to our school after travelling around the country with their families.
